website_summaries.verdict: This clever model from the reputable Coleman offers users a built-in pillow with a self-inflating design.
pros: Comes with compression straps for quickly deflating pad
Included pillow is built-in to prevent pillow from sliding
cons: Pad could use some extra breaths after self-inflation

website_summaries.verdict: A basic and affordable self-inflating camping pad.
pros: Self inflates for quick and effortless setup
Integrated pillow and tufted design for comfort
Easy to use and roll up
Compact and highly portable when deflated
cons: Pillow needs to be manually inflated
Securing straps could be more durable

customer_reviews.title: Some leaks after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: I liked this pad the first few times I used it. Unfortunately by the fifth time I woke finding myself on the ground. There was a pinhole sized leak near the vent. I patched it and figured it would be fine. The next use I got another hole on the opposite side, same place. The material keeps rubbing or hitting the inner plastic of the vent and I get holes. I love all Coleman products I have. Their name usually gives me confidence in the product, but I was not happy with this one.
customer_reviews.author: TheRealNicl

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality and doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: Full of leaks after 1 camping trip. Very poor quality and doesn't last.
customer_reviews.author: Active Engineer

customer_reviews.title: The mat inflates nicely by itself and with a few extra breaths
customer_reviews.text: The mat inflates nicely by itself and with a few extra breaths, it can obtain a comfortable firmness. I have always found Coleman products to be reliable and good quality, however, this mat is the exception. Upon using it for the first time, one of the straps ripped away from the pad where they were factory attached. With only one attached strap, it makes rolling the mat back up difficult and clumsy. I would ask for a replacement, but I bought this mat well before our trip and it has exceeded the 30 day return window. Very disappointed in the quality of this particular sleep pad.
customer_reviews.author: ChickenMamaChick

customer_reviews.title: Very nice padding (will tame some pretty mean roots that might ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice padding (will tame some pretty mean roots that might otherwise impale). The pillow is a nice feature as well. The only downsides I see about this product at this point are that it really should be given 24hrs. for the first inflate to fully get the maximum loft, and then good luck rolling it back up that tightly :). Also, it is a little heavy (if backpacking), although this is not a problem if not going very far with it. Overall, a good product and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, but heavy for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: This was by far the heaviest item on my pack. That being said, it made sleeping on those hard shelter wooden slats SO much more comfortable, so it was worth the extra weight. I found that after allowing the pad to self-inflate, giving it another 20 or so blows (just right into the unscrewed valve), it made it much more padded and comfortable. You do have to blow up the pillow separately, which requires 7-8 good blows. I ended up letting some of the air back out though because I don't like such a "firm" pillow. Leaving it slightly deflated makes for a "softer" pillow so to speak.
customer_reviews.author: J. Manser

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: A great sleeping pad for car camping. A bit too heavy or bulky for trail hiking, and I think that the thickness is closer to 2 inches, rather than the advertised 2.5 inches. That said, it fits my 6 foot 1 inch, 250 pound. frame comfortably and I am happy with it. It will take about a half hour to self inflate, and then must be topped off with some lung power. Take note that the outer material is a bit slippery, which might cause you and your sleeping bag to slide off during the night. Sliding a bag liner over the pad might resolve this. I would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Demons

customer_reviews.title: Compact enough
customer_reviews.text: If you want something that collapses to an impossibly small size, regardless of whether it actually serves the intended function, look elsewhere. If you want a self-inflating pad that just works, this is it. Inflates nearly instantly, thick enough to provide cushioning, even distribution, and collapses just as easily. Yes, it takes up more room than some, but you'll get a better night's sleep and be on your way while your gear-tech buddy is still trying to get his into that tiny bag and ignore the crick in his neck.
customer_reviews.author: N. Davenport

customer_reviews.title: Straps broke on first use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to use to go camping. A strap broke off the rivet on both of them. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle T.

customer_reviews.title: The bed itself works great. It's not an air mattress but it definitely ...
customer_reviews.text: The bed itself works great. It's not an air mattress but it definitely self inflated, is super low maintenance to set up and is comfortable to sleep on for a few nights in a row. However, I am posting a 2 star review based on the storage strap. After my first time using this pad the storage strap ripped off while I was rolling the pad back up to be put away.
customer_reviews.author: Gunnison12

customer_reviews.title: Pillow and Time warning
customer_reviews.text: The mat is pretty slim, but thats fine. The inflatable pillow part might be better for supporting a pillow verses using it as a pillow, but again.. you can use it. The other thing is keep this thing inflated 24 hours before using or you will get a flat mat that won't help a lot. I used this thing for 3 days straight for camping purposes and it was semi comfortable. Super easy to use to move around, I can just see not everyone having as good as time with it like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Demetri

customer_reviews.title: Fair value and option.
customer_reviews.text: They are thicker then the last mat I had. So that is more comfortable. But not a dream of softness or support. Just adequate to get a few hours sleep before you wake up hurting. Used it two nights in a row. Also taller and wider so a 6 foot person will fit just fine. The pillow is nice addition but don’t expect it to be too comfortable. It needs something on top of it like a shirt or sleeping bag. Not a small package so backpacking with it not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: Recommended -- comfortable for the price, but some faults
customer_reviews.text: Pros: *Self-inflation works very well *Quite comfortable for a $30 pad *Build quality of the pad itself seems solid *Nice and wide Cons: *Lack of air chambers can allow pressure points (but, again, this is a $30 pad) *Packed size is huge, and I say that as a car camper, not a backpacker *It's an absolute nightmare to roll up and get the compression straps around. I dread putting it away. Can we get another couple of inches on those straps, Coleman?? All in all a decent pad, and great for the price. I'll keep it as a backup to my Klymite Luxe.
customer_reviews.author: emilyf

customer_reviews.title: No issues, even with moderately hard usage.
customer_reviews.text: Have used this thing for close to a year now. Roughly once a month. I'm a national guard member and I've used this thing everywhere from a court room floor during a flood response to a hasty fighting position (8 inch hole in the ground) to extra padding on top of a cot. No plastic smell, rolls up fairly quickly, fairly durable from what I've used it for. No pinholes or ripped straps. Only con is it's fairly heavy on top of all the other gear I carry. Better than the issued sleeping mat. Washes off fairly easily.
customer_reviews.author: Random Tabitha

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with a Hole
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for a GS Camping Trip .... opened it up and it had a hole in it so that was a huge disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Korinne

customer_reviews.title: Not very comfortable but good product
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 of these and used them only twice so cannot comment on the quality problems others had. However if you leave them open for an hour or so, it inflates enough. You can still blow in one or two times to make it harder. You need a linen on it in warmer temperatures where you do not use sleeping bag, otherwise you will sweat like crazy because of nylon surface. Also it is a hard sleeping surface, not as soft as inflatable beds (which are also uncomfortably soft). Overall, it is easy to inflate, deflate and roll back.
customer_reviews.author: Yavuz

customer_reviews.title: Back saver very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is a must if your tent camping it self inflates and is easy to deflate and roll back up. I bought it for a week long motorcycle trip around Florida and it was a back saver while the other guys were busy pumping up their air mattress all I had to do was unroll it and open the valve same thing when we packed up open valve and roll it up. It was small enough I could strap it to the back seat and use for back support as well. The inflatable pillow was a nice bonus it saved me some room so I didn't have to pack a pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Streetglide

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and easy
customer_reviews.text: We had been using steel framed cots for awhile that were heavy and hard to put together. These are so much better and way more comfortable. I like the pillow feature because we don't have to pack a pillow. They are quick to inflate and you can adjust for comfort level. What I like about these is that it has a pad for added comfort so it's not just sleeping on air alone.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda S.

customer_reviews.title: I bought another one for my wife
customer_reviews.text: I have had it two years and used it a few times. It is very convenient and durable. It rolls back up into the original shape without any trouble. And it is very easy to inflate; no pump needed is fantastic. It provides just the right amount of cushioning without being bulky. The inflatable pillow is not great, but it's better than nothing. I usually forget to bring a pillow anyway so this ensures I at least have something. I see it as a bonus item; you have the option of leaving it deflated and using your own pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Chadwick Smith

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: This pad is surprisingly comfortable; the campsite flat area had more large, jagged rocks than typical and the pad stopped them from coming though. The pillow takes some getting used to and I suggest supplementing an additional pillow. The self-inflate feature does half the work, so expect to finish blowing it up manually. All in all I was very impressed with it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Lees

customer_reviews.title: Thick comfy pad
customer_reviews.text: Really thick comfy pad. Slept on it three nights camping pregnant really helped since sleeping on the ground has always been hard for me even as a teen with my curvy body type. One problem when I rolled it up the first time to put it away the strap literally broke off. It didn’t tear into the mat which has a seared shut layer that it didn’t tear into during the rip. Still able to tie it up rolled up but not attached. Kinda thick and large for rolling up to take backpacking. Kinda heavy 4.4 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Teron & Megan

customer_reviews.title: Good for car-camping.
customer_reviews.text: It does a good job self inflating to a point. Soft enough for camping. The attached pillow sometimes gets in the way. We tend to under inflate it, while using a small pillow as well. It is a nice feature though. Usually pillows do fall off due to the nature of the nylon construction of most camping stuff. Nice product. Don't over tighten the attached straps.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Mike

customer_reviews.title: Gives good support but has 2 flaws
customer_reviews.text: The pad is comfortable and gives good support. There are two areas of flaw (1st) the straps to secure the device when folded is attached to the tail end and rips out when attempting to secure the device (2nd) the head rest inflation valve is very lose and constantly cause the head rest to deflate.
customer_reviews.author: Clarkie

customer_reviews.title: Self-inlates to full 2 1/2 inches.
customer_reviews.text: Insane value! The first time I layed the product out and watched it actually self-inflate, I was blown away. Also, stowing it takes a little effort to roll up when forcing the air out of the small diameter valve; I would not recommend this product for anyone who does not have full finger/hand strength. My next emergency deployment will be significantly more comfortable with this product in my gear.
customer_reviews.author: RobertKarl

customer_reviews.title: Good mattress pad with poor carrying facility
customer_reviews.text: Good mattress pad with poor carrying facility. It is hard to wrap this mattress pad after use because it does not have any strap to tie it after rolling it. Now it is lying in my basement as nobody wants to use it. so cumbersome to carry !!! with nothing to roll it.
customer_reviews.author: Neeraj Sharan

customer_reviews.title: helping make sleeping on a cot suck less
customer_reviews.text: This is a huge help when camping and using my cot. The padding is nice however I still need a blanket on top to give it that real bed feeling. The blow up pillow is nice however can tough on your neck if you blow it up too much. I suggest getting some straps or something to hold the mat in place when using it on a cot because if you toss and turn it tends to move around.
customer_reviews.author: M. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Nice when it worked
customer_reviews.text: worked well until it broke. I've had this item for 6 months now and where the nozzle and material meet has torn. Now when i lie on it it won't stay inflated and when i have it rolled up it tries to take in air. I expected more out of this item. 2 stars - was nice when it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable camp pad at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I put a lot of research into camp pads for my son & I for his scout trips. I purchased two of these pads & they are very comfortable, & self inflate quickly. You have to manually blow up the pillow part just like you would an inflatable pool raft. These are large when packed up but we mostly car camp. I did take one of these on a wilderness canoe camping trip where I slept on wooden platforms & it worked perfectly & packed just fine in a canoe. These were also a great price.
customer_reviews.author: AdvRacer

customer_reviews.title: So so sleeping pad
customer_reviews.text: These pads are so so! First of all they only 'self-inflate' to 1 inch. If you put an additional 10 breaths in them you may approach 2 inches (stretching it). They are so so comfortable - especially with anyone with a hint of disc issues. I bought 2 - and the attached straps to cinch them down to get the air out immediately broke off one of them. So I bought a replacement pad (stupid me). First time I used that the straps also broke off. Save your money and invest in a stronger cinching system. The price seemed good - but you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: So-so
customer_reviews.text: Heavy and very plastic-y feeling and smelling. After airing it out and leaving it inflated for a week or so, it finally smoothed out and the small faded some. To call is "self-inflating" is true only if you want it to self inflate about half-way, and then you finish it off by blowing it up, like you have to blow up the so-so pillow. I like Coleman stuff, but this one is pretty so-so. In fact, that sums up this pad in my book. Just so-so.
customer_reviews.author: RGModsTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: WORTH it!
customer_reviews.text: These made a huge difference in our camping trips! Not that sleeping on the cold hard ground isn't part of camping, but these are a very nice addition. They stayed inflated for two nights and are very comfortable. Easy to inflate and deflate, lightweight for packing, and don't take up too much room. They even come with patches in case you happen to get a hole in the lining.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: The pad is nice but just beaware that you have to manually blow ...
customer_reviews.text: The pad is nice but just beaware that you have to manually blow up the pillow. It does not self inflate with the rest of the pad.
customer_reviews.author: SML

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate sizing, ordered 2 of the same and neither was like the description.
customer_reviews.text: Highly irregular production. I ordered 2 of the same pads labeled as 2.5 inches thick. One was just about 2 inches and the other was less than 1.5 inches when fully inflated. So annoying! Returned and am crossing fingers that the next order of camping pads are actually 2.5 inches thick.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: It's fantastic. My son uses this for Boy Scout camping ...
customer_reviews.text: It's fantastic. My son uses this for Boy Scout camping and absolutely loves it. I was disappointed that one of the straps broke early on, but we have replacement straps for it. It's a very high-quality item. He did his week-long summer camp on it and a few others and it has held up wonderfully. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Best air pad
customer_reviews.text: Adopting an automatic wind-filling system, this product is very easy to blow into the mat. The pillow must be blown manually. For those with low back pain, this air bed is recommended. It's a quality product that I use at home, as usual.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: The pad itself is relatively comfortable to sleep on
customer_reviews.text: The pad itself is relatively comfortable to sleep on. The material, however, is rather fragile. I tore the edge of the mattress trying to cinch down the compression straps. Those straps, by the way, are one of the things that keep this from having a lower rating. They are quite handy and a good addition.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Rogneby

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper and better than the Thermarest
customer_reviews.text: This pad is cheaper than my son's Thermarest Trail Scout and WAY more comfortable. Still needs a little extra air blown it when its "self-inflating" but no biggie. Would be better without the pillow in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Tony17

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price
customer_reviews.text: This took awhile to inflate right out of the box but worked good after it had some time to inflate. We used this for camping in the back yard with the kids. We liked it enough to purchase another youth version.
customer_reviews.author: Northern Man Craft

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: - gets about 3-4 cm thick - the only downrate is because the first time we tried rolling it back up the grommets ripped out that hold the straps on. there's no real need to have the straps attached, but now there's a weak point.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff H

customer_reviews.title: I was Impressed Amazon has better items for its purpose
customer_reviews.text: it inflates slightly thicker than a yoga mat and rolls to be the size of a standard sleeping bag. the pillows basically just a larger sewn on swimming childrens swimmy. its large and really uncomfortable I had to return it I feel like the one i got was defective it took a while to inflate and was never really fully inflated.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Ray K

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product--self inflates in a very short time
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Self inflates quickly, and then just a couple of puffs, and it is filled up., Very comfortable. The negative is that it is quite bulky--which is OK if you are in a vehicle. Not good for backpacking. The price point is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Mansoor Shafi

customer_reviews.title: Supportive and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This mattress pad is extremely comfortable compared to my other mattress pad. The foam inside that expands the pad make it supportive an comfortable. It’s also great that you can adjust the pillow independently to your liking. Too bad the mattress pad does not come with a cover to store away the pad and keeping it clean. And it does not fold away like some of these new pad that fits into the palm of your hands.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great Sleeping Pad!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this pad! I have used other self-inflatable pads in the past and so far this is the best one. Inflates in seconds and provides superior comfort. Used it in a hammock and directly on the ground and it works perfect on both surfaces. Like I mentioned already this is the most comfortable pad that I have ever used especially when it comes to sleeping directly on the ground. The quality of the product is pretty good and I believe that it will last. Would highly recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Julian K

customer_reviews.title: It help shield from the cold ground but doesnt make it more comfortable. It does Inflate just like the description says ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for Camping. We do one camp a year when we have to sleep on the ground. This pad doesn't make much difference. It help shield from the cold ground but doesnt make it more comfortable. It does Inflate just like the description says and is easy to deflate and roll up.
customer_reviews.author: L.Tyc

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: After a ton of searching for reasonably priced yet comfortable camping mats, I finally decided on this one. We bought two, and our only complaint is that the two could not be connected together. This was easily fixed with a bit of duct tape. Otherwise. these mats were easy to set up and comfortable all night long. They are reasonably wide so you don't feel like you might roll off at any moment too! I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Kinney

customer_reviews.title: Well-padded mat that survived a well-padded user with no problems!
customer_reviews.text: This camp pad provided more than enough padding to keep me comfortable throughout the night on surfaces including well-packed dirt, solid stone, gravel, and grass. Unlike a few reviewers, I had no trouble with this pad "bottoming out" or deflating during the night, despite how heavy I am. Due to the relative difficulty of getting the air back out of this pad, I am giving this product four stars instead of five. Other than that, I have no real complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Alkdth

customer_reviews.title: It is comfortable. The instructions say to allow 24 hours for ...
customer_reviews.text: It is comfortable. The instructions say to allow 24 hours for full self inflation. Really? Lol. I've had it 6 months and it has developed a leak around the valve so it is shot.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Straps will rip off.
customer_reviews.text: Took backpacking into the Zion Narrows. A little bulky but not too heavy. The straps that hold it together ripped off after the first use. The straps on my Coleman tent also ripped. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Motorcycle camping
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and easy to use. Only bad thing I could say about the pad is that it does not come with a bag to cover it when you roll it up. Outside of that the pad was great and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I was quite impressed with the self-inflating pad and how much air it allowed in. It is much more comfortable than I would have thought. My only complaint is that it is a bit bigger than I thought it would be when rolled up and the pillow is impossible to get comfortable on (will be bringing something else next time). Overall you really can't beat the comfort for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and value!
customer_reviews.text: You will NOT be disappointed with the excellent construction and value of this self-inflating camping pad mattress and pillow. I unscrewed the valve and it filled right up with no problems at all. I am VERY pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Works great - recommend
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm. Blew up easily and stayed blow up to create enough cushion under the sleeping bag. Bought another brand and it didn’t hold a candle to this one - I returned the other one and ordered two more of these.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Davis

customer_reviews.title: too difficult to find the sweetspot for this sidesleeper
customer_reviews.text: I'm a side sleeper so, too little air and you're feeling the hard floor and any bumbs underneath, too much air and it feel like laying on plywood. messing around in the middle of the night to find that perfect sweetspot is not worth it. Will give this to the kds and stick with the inflatable one that looks like a pool float, it was way more comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Kelley B

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase in general
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the yoga mat I used for camping for this product. Bought one for me and my GF. One works perfect but the other has difficulty closing correctly. The cap where the air goes in/out does not close snug, it turns then pops back open. It never turns and stops, you have to guage when it is actually closed or you will just keep spinning the cap open/closed. Would be a better design if it closed like a bottle cap where it tightens when its closed. 4 stars for the comfort and convenience. Lost one star for the cap design.
customer_reviews.author: IJ Hale

customer_reviews.title: Great pad for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great pad for the money. It worked perfectly and was super comfortable (although we kind of cheated and had some carpet in our yurt underneath our pads). The inflatable pillow might be useful if someone was hiking in but for me was superfluous. I ended up deflating the pillow by half the second night. All n all a good pad!
customer_reviews.author: Butthatsjustme

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Well, so many other reviews nailed it. Good for the price. Good not great. Yes, comfortable. No, it doesn't inflate and deflate without assistance. Yes, the straps break off easily.
customer_reviews.author: Illiterati

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Designed Straps
customer_reviews.text: After opening, left it to inflate for 24 hours per the directions. Comfortable for what it is, but the first time I rolled it up, the strap tore away. The strap is connected by a thin strip of plastic that I can't see lasting many uses even if it had survived the first one. *UPDATE: Due to the pandemic, the return process was difficult so I decided to keep it as it is comfortable. The next time I rolled it up, the second strap tore away so badly it ripped into the actual mattress area, so now the nozzle is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: It inflates and deflates easily. You have to blow the pillow up yourself ...
customer_reviews.text: I shopped around quite a bit before buying this pad. It inflates and deflates easily. You have to blow the pillow up yourself but it's super easy and quick. It does a pretty good job of keeping you comfortable and doesn't lose air overnight. It stores easily but definitely is not as small as it was when it first arrived without a lot of effort. But we don't care since we roll them up and leave them in our garage.
customer_reviews.author: LisaLouWho

customer_reviews.title: Probably good in a sleeping bag but not thick enough on its own.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for backyard camping. It was ok to sleep on but it's too thin to really provide comfort. Haven't tried with a sleeping bag yet, but the combination might provide more padding. I wouldn't recommend this by itself for sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: NJ4Beatles

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Easy to setup.
customer_reviews.text: I used it for camping trip. Loved it. Easy to setup. Inflates quick and deflates with no much effort. I bought a second one for my husband.
customer_reviews.author: Happybuyer

customer_reviews.title: OK Pad
customer_reviews.text: This didn't provide the comfort I was expecting based on the reviews, but it's an acceptable pad. If I had to do it over I would spend a little more and get something a little more upmarket. The inflated pillow is worthless for me.
customer_reviews.author: Josh A

customer_reviews.title: Buy elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: One of the straps broke off only after a couple uses. Coleman that’s horrible. I expect better. Go buy elsewhere people
customer_reviews.author: Landon Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: and the pillow is not comfortable. Takes forever to deflate and roll back up
customer_reviews.text: Takes awhile to inflate, is not very thick, and the pillow is not comfortable. Takes forever to deflate and roll back up.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa A Driscoll

customer_reviews.title: Simple and useful
customer_reviews.text: This is incredibly useful: I feel like I never need to bring an air mattress and just this instead because I don't have to bother my friends with a loud inflator. the inflating pillow is great, and the self-inflating pad is awesome. I would rate it 5 stars if it was just a little wider though.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Polo

customer_reviews.title: worked great, very comortable
customer_reviews.text: worked great, very comortable! wish it was a bit wider, as my sleeping bag hung over the sides and i also wish they would line the top with something so my sleeping bag wouldn't slide all over the place. the first time i used it was sleeping on a very slight incline and i woke up in the middle of the night at the bottom of the pad! i had slid right off of it while sleeping!
customer_reviews.author: TJRUNS

customer_reviews.title: For car camping maybe; but.....
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT a lightweight backpacking pad. It could work for car camping, but if your car camping you can get something much more comfortable easily and probably cheaper. Pros = 1. price, but you get what you pay for. Cons = 1. as you see in the picture the strap came off in the first week.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Worked great once I read the instructions
customer_reviews.text: Worked great once I read the instructions. I allowed it to fill for overnight and then deflated and at next use it was perfect for our Girl Scout camping trip. Nice insulation from the floor and enough padding for comfortable sleeping. Easy to roll back up and sturdy straps
customer_reviews.author: L. Curtis

customer_reviews.title: One fine, one faulty.
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these for car camping. One is great. The other developed a leaky valve on our second trip with it. Fail.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne Q

customer_reviews.title: hard to blow up
customer_reviews.text: you must use your mouth to inflate this, and the way the valve is -- its not the easiest. But the mat is comfortable, even on top of small rocks and sticks.
customer_reviews.author: Purple Mountain Tsampa

customer_reviews.title: Fully inflate the first time you use it
customer_reviews.text: This comes rolled VERY tight. Just unrolling and opening the valve will not do much. I inflated all the way by blowing into the valve and then let some air out. It also helped to roll from the bottom to the top while inflated to force air into the top half. Very comfortable now. Not sure if I'll have to do this every time but it is worth taking a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hersey

customer_reviews.title: but we still added a few puffs of air to get a better inflation. Didn't lose air for 3 nights of ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my daughters to use for girls camp since they don't allow air mattresses. We camp several times a year with air mattresses, and my girls agreed these were actually more comfy. Self inflating, but we still added a few puffs of air to get a better inflation. Didn't lose air for 3 nights of use. These may be replacing our usual air mattresses for campouts!
customer_reviews.author: Amethyst

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for sure.
customer_reviews.text: It makes the hard ground easy to sleep on, love it for that. But, the inflation nozzle is at my feet. What if I want to inflate or deflate in the middle of the night? I’m an experienced backpacker. Move it to the pillow end please.
customer_reviews.author: Rita Kuhl

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Pillow is hard to inflate but the mattress part is great. The self inflation is very quick and made sleeping on the ground much easier to do.
customer_reviews.author: David F Rent

customer_reviews.title: Save you money
customer_reviews.text: A cotton quilt is just as good. I'm sorry I bought it
customer_reviews.author: suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Good, but premature leakage.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 4 years, about 40 nights before it started leaking. Can't find the hole so it's in the seam somewhere. It was only ever used on top of a cot. I really liked it! Was quick and easy to use. I'm a big guy, so it might last longer for someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Brewing_Master

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, but be careful with the straps
customer_reviews.text: On my first use of this, the fabric tie ripped off -- don't pull them too tightly! That said, these are comfortable and durable. I'm 6'6" and 240#, and these have held up for a season of camping very well. I'm buying more!
customer_reviews.author: Charlie White

customer_reviews.title: It's not ultralight, but it's comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The self-inflating feature is nice, but I did add a few breaths to fill it completely. It's also a bit big, but it's perfect for camping if your vehicle is parked nearby. The pillow is great half-inflated.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Price & comfort/packs nicely but its a little long
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping pad, it’s my second one I’ve purchased as a gift. It does what it’s intend to do. I’m 180 pounds and with my sleeping bag or with out It always provides enough cushion and comfort. Do no expect to get the same feel of an air mattress. It’s better to carry and much more convenient. I’ve used a smaller and more compact sleeping pad that barely had any support and I felt my elbows against the ground. Besides it packing long it’s still an amazing pad.
customer_reviews.author: vicky batista

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my wife. She hasn't used it but upon inspection it appears to be very adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This pad looks good when it blows up automatically
customer_reviews.text: This pad looks good when it blows up automatically. It is hard to roll it back. Also the straps and very poorly designed when rolling it back to original shape. The strap broke from the first use. Did not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Elias Stephan

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but does not roll up small for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Good for car camping and I did strap to my backpack but it takes up 5 times as much room as our tent, they do not roll small. Very comfortable as camp pads go, but one does have to blow up the pillow which takes a good deal of breath and I had to do both my girl and mine, a few extra large breathes are needes for the self inflating portion too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would be great if the valve wasn't cheap
customer_reviews.text: These come with a low quality valve. after only a couple of uses I started having a problem where the air escapes and I have to open the valve to let it self inflate again 3 or 4 times a night. I go camping almost every month and was really happy with this purchase until I started having the problem.
customer_reviews.author: B Posegate

customer_reviews.title: Valve leaked on mine.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this pad approx 7 times. The valve is leaking slowly and half way through the night it goes as flat as it can get. I had to get up, open the valve and wait a few minutes so it can fully expand again. There is now known way to fix it. Disappointed. I must say however, I love the pad and it supports my 205 lb body quite well. Please fix the valve!
customer_reviews.author: aktmjcor

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Cullman used to have a pretty decent sleeping pad you can tell they really tried to cut costs with the sleeping pad it is of the quality where I would probably work one to two times and then after that start to fall apart piece of junk
customer_reviews.author: Tom Baer

customer_reviews.title: "A" for this sleeping pad
customer_reviews.text: Loved this sleeping pad. It auto-inflated well and quickly and kept me warm on the ground in my tent. The pillow part was a little hard to blow up, but it worked nicely as cushioning for my head. Overall, great product. My only "con" is that it still a little large rolled up. I had to carry it separately by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Julie A.

customer_reviews.title: It is great and I camped with it for 6 nights in ...
customer_reviews.text: This really does self inflate. Know that when you are. Trying to roll it up it is a full body event, but is entirely possible. I didn't realize right away the pillow needs to be filled manually. It is great and I camped with it for 6 nights in a row and oved it.
customer_reviews.author: T.Y.

customer_reviews.title: Good for camping
customer_reviews.text: Sleeping pad was easy to inflate and deflate/roll up. Much more comfortable and quieter than traditional blow up pads. The built in pillow is great too! Though it saves you space by foregoing packing a pillow, the pad itself does not deflate very small. Good for camping, maybe not for backpacking
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Huizenga

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I love this Camping pad. I have used this 4 times now and it works perfectly.All i need to do is open the valve and it self inflates in no time.The pillow doesnt self inflate though.
customer_reviews.author: ThembaJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice pad, except for pillow
customer_reviews.text: Nice pad although pillow part is a bit useless and not comfortable. If I bought another I’d forget the pillow type.
customer_reviews.author: kayak99

customer_reviews.title: the valve for the pillow slowly leaked from the time ...
customer_reviews.text: the valve for the pillow slowly leaked from the time I opened it. 2 hours after blowing it up, it was flat. Needless to say it was frustrating camping trip. I will not be using this pad again. I will give it to someone shorter to use.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Other than that it worked pretty well. I set up an exchange for a ...
customer_reviews.text: Upon receiving this pad I unrolled it and one of the straps was not attached to the pad. Other than that it worked pretty well. I set up an exchange for a new pad with Amazon and received a new pad at no cost. Will be using this in June for the first time, and will give an update at that time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This camp pad is working out great for me
customer_reviews.text: This camp pad is working out great for me. I've used it 5 or 6 times. it keeps me off the ground, but packs better than an air mattress and doesn't deflate through the night. The pillow isn't really great, but I didn't expect an inflatable pillow to be very comfy. One of the straps broke the first time I used the pad, but it hasn't slowed down my use. I'd recommend as an entry camping pad.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Murray

customer_reviews.title: Great for car camping
customer_reviews.text: Too heavy for backpacking, but very good for car camping and most Boy Scout trips. Much thicker and wider than my old Thermarest, at a fraction of the cost. I haven't use the pillow part because I always use a Cocoon travel pillow.
customer_reviews.author: W. Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Strap ripped off
customer_reviews.text: After giving this as a gift to our son, we inflated it. It inflated quickly and my son said it was comfortable. The very first time we rolled it up and then pulled the strap to secure it closed, the strap came right off, ripping the matress. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Theis

customer_reviews.title: These are great pads! Friends who have the more expensive brands ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great pads! Friends who have the more expensive brands have commented that they like these even more than theirs. The pillows seem a bit odd on these at first, but they can be left deflated if you bring your own pillow or inflated if you forget to bring another. I have had them out six times so far this summer and they are holding up well. A recommended purchase!
customer_reviews.author: JHall

customer_reviews.title: pad is comfortable and works well
customer_reviews.text: pad is comfortable and works well. Will not take much abuse and defiantly only for the occasional user. my first use with it I got a hole in it, I have repaired it and it seems ok . I would recommend always having something between pad and whatever you are laying on and careful when storing it.
customer_reviews.author: J. G.

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly versatile
customer_reviews.text: We use this for camping, sleepovers, nights on the floor in front of the fire in living room
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Self-Inflate feature note
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this purchase. One thing to note, when taken out of the box and unrolled for the first time, it did not self-inflate. I had to manually blow it up. However after releasing that air, it was ready to go and is self-inflates as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Hale

customer_reviews.title: Deflates very quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Got it just before a trip and decided to test it. So after letting it sit for an hour or so, finalised the pressure with few blows and unfortunately it lost all the pressure in about half an our. Couldn't find any holes in it and returned it. 5 stars for the return policy, but only one for the product.
customer_reviews.author: Mauras

customer_reviews.title: No way
customer_reviews.text: Trash. First time I rolled it up, tugging on the straps, the rivets popped right out at the end, draining the air permanently.
customer_reviews.author: miket

customer_reviews.title: but the built in pillow was good for nothing for me
customer_reviews.text: This stayed inflated well while I was using, but the built in pillow was good for nothing for me. The first night, I had blown up the pillow part and was very disappointed that I did not bring another pillow with me on my 4 day camping trip in Utah. I preferred using a balled-up sweatshirt on top of a travel pillow (the kind for airplanes) over the built in pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Beandale

product_meta.title: Coleman Self-Inflating Camping Pad with Pillow
product_meta.description: Enjoy additional support and cushioning with the Coleman Self-Inflating Camping Pad with Pillow. This camping sleeping pad features a comfy tufted design that adds an extra layer of padding between your sleeping bag and the ground. Equipped with a free-flow valve, the sleeping pad self-inflates with no air pump needed. Simply roll it out and open the valve, and the pad will begin inflating. When it's time to pack up, reopen the valve and push the air out using the compression straps. Thanks to its durable, weather-resistant polyester shell, this camping sleeping pad can endure night after night of use.
feature_bullets: Inflatable sleeping pad provides extra cushioning on camping trips
Soft, tufted design provides an extra layer of padding between your sleeping bag and the ground
Self-inflating design; free-flow valve inflates the pad with no air pump required
Compression straps force out air for quick deflation
Durable polyester shell endures tough use. Inflated dimensions is 76 x 25 x 2.5 inch
